snippet: The removal of 17 Air Force officers from watching over nuclear-tipped missiles is part of a bigger underlying problem.
abstract: Editorial on removal of 17 Air Force officers from watching over nuclear-tipped missiles; cites experts who say incident is symptomatic of malaise afflicting missile crews since cold war ended, due to fact that they have been marginalized by Air Force culture that prizes aircraft pilots.
lead_paragraph: The removal of 17 Air Force officers from watching over nuclear-tipped missiles is part of a bigger underlying problem.

headline.seo: Cold War Malaise in Air Force Unit
headline.main: Cold War Malaise at Launch Control
headline.print_headline: Cold War Malaise at Launch Control

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
